author: Staff Reporter
text:
Stating that they should not be evicted from their area, Ponammapet residents came to the Salem collectorate to submit petition on Monday.—Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

Residents of Ponammapet Railway Line South Street in the city submitted a petition to the Collector against evicting them here on Monday. They said that they have been residing in the area for more than 70 years.

Residents said that over 1,000 families residing in the area for many generations by constructing their own houses.

But, recently they were asked to vacate their land by Jamia Masjid member. They said that they were subjected to harassment by them and could not live there peacefully.

Residents said that they are poor people who cannot construct new houses again. They also said that the land belongs to them as they were residing there for many years and were against evicting them. They demanded protection from them and also wanted patta for their land site.
title: Residents against evicting from their area
